title: The Kingdom Saga by Steven and L.R Styles (01-02)
description:
Steve is originally from Bronx, New york. Raised by immigrant parents from the dominican republic, Steve has had a passion for writing since he was little.

Genre: Fantasy


Book #1 - The Road To The King

In a vast, island nation--lying alone in the Great Sea between the East and West--prosperity and peace dwelt from one shore to the other. From its high rocky peaks to the North to the swamps and cliffs of the South--and all great forests, small villages and bustling towns in between--the citizens of The Kingdom live and work in safety. Beneath the calm surface, however, dwells a vile and secret society... a simmering corruption just waiting to emerge to swallow the entire nation. Stumbled upon by a mere peasant solider--a lieutenant on routine patrol of a rural highway--the hidden evil destroys the entire unit of Kingdom soldiers, leaving its leader wounded, galloping madly for home. 

As Lieutenant John Asher lies dying on his own table, he recruits his young son, Joseph, to swiftly bear a warning message to the King. Alone and grieving his father, the boy navigates the highways to the Capitol City, by the Great Bay. He finds a way into the Palace citadel and finally finds audience with the mysterious monarch and his elite guard, the Shamar. Impressed by young Joseph's bravery, the king grants him an unusual reward: an aristocrat's education alongside his training, as a blacksmith. Despite ridicule and strife, Joseph grows into a skilled swordsman, practicing his trade of smithing until called upon by the king to service, to stand in the way of the poison now creeping into his land...

Book #2 - In The Service Of The King

The continued tale & quests of Joseph Asher of Rishown. Elevated by the king, himself, to title and land Joseph oversees the estate of the Stone Mountain, on the fringes of the Great Bay in secret. Making no haste to reveal his new-found wealth, he rides with his fellow Shamar on increasingly important missions for the king.

The Monarch is determined to route out the remaining vestiges of corruption that once infested his shores, but even he does not realize how quickly it has re-birthed in the dark, among the treasures of the Deep. Amid the dangers, Joseph secretly write letter to Elizabeth HaysÃ¢â‚¬â€œstill posing as a peasant blacksmithÃ¢â‚¬â€œhoping she still cares for him.Many perils await Joseph Asher before he can finally pursue the comforts of more peaceful times.
